pull.title: Add friendly output to dumpwallet
pull.body:
Add friendly output to dumpwallet #9564.

* Add help message.
* Show created dumpfile path.
* Add rpc test.

events.body:
utACK 48abaea.

I also want to explicitly approve of the returning of a JSON rather than a plain string, it may be useful (in future work?) to augment this call's return value with other data as well (e.g., which user owns the dump file, how many keys were dumped, etc).
This seems ready to be merged once 0.14 is branched off.

Definite concept ACK. A couple of nitty comments about language.

I agree that it'd be better to change the default location to be the bitcoin datadir if possible, but that might be out of scope of this small PR.

issue.title: rpc: Prevent `dumpwallet` from overwriting files
issue.body:
Prevent arbitrary files from being overwritten by `dumpwallet`. There have been reports that users have overwritten wallet files this way. It may also avoid other security issues.

Fixes #9934. Adds mention to release notes and adds a test.

events.body:
Thank you for your comments and sorry for my late reply.

I just updated help text and qualified function name.
"chdir daemon to the data-dir" and "dump the wallet over the network" are quite interesting. But it's out of scope of this PR as jnewbery said.

events.message: Add friendly output to dumpwallet refs #9564

issue.title: TODO for release notes 0.15.0
issue.body:
Whenever possible, please amend the `doc/release-notes.md` within the pull that introduces a new fancy feature or breaks compatibility.

If this is not possible, please mention the pull here, so it can be taken care of later:

* [x] RBF GUI (#9592, ...)
* [x] #9602: Remove coin age priority and free transactions
* [x] [wallet] Rescan abortability #10208 adds `abortrescan` RPC
* [x] leveldb 1.20 #10138
* [x] #9733 adds `getchaintxstats` RPC
* [x] #9966 adds `-persistmempool` option
* [x] #8952 adds query options to `listunspent` RPC
* [x] #10478 adds `bindaddr` address for peer connections to `getpeerinfo` 
* [x] #9740 makes `dumpwallet` return the full absolute path to the dumped wallet
* [x] #10400 adds `uptime` command
* [x] Move transaction combining from signrawtransaction to new RPC #10571
* [x]  Do not allow users to get keys from keypool without reserving them #10784 


<sub>Feel free to edit

The release notes are now edited on the wiki:

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/0.15.0-Release-notes

issue.title: dumpwallet behavior
issue.body:
In v0.13: `dumpwallet` "dumps all wallet keys in a human-readable format." (according to console help).

First, it's hard to tell *where* it dumps them.
```
Arguments:
1. "filename"    (string, required) The filename
```
I executed the action and couldn't find the file. Another way to look at this is "I executed the action and nothing happened".
Well, it turns out it did work, but the file ended up in the Bitcoin "root" directory (for me, `c:\Bitcoin`). 
I bet some users would think that the command simply didn't work and you can see where it goes from there.

Second, the action behavior isn't particularly intuitive. 
For example, I'm in `E:\backup` and I run 
`c:\bitcoin\bin\bitcoin-cli.exe dumpwallet wallet.txt`
I think this shouldn't dump the wallet to c:\bitcoin\wallet.txt.

`dumpwallet e:\backup\wallet.txt`works as expected (both from debug console and from the CLI).

This could be classified as a doco bug (e.g. change "The filename" to "The full path and filename"), or it could be improved in the code.

OS: English Windows 10 x64.

comments.body:
Interesting. Shouldn't it be only accepting absolute paths in the first place?
Otherwise it will depend on the directory that bitcoind happens to have been started in, that'd be pretty crappy API design.

Thanx.
IMO, it is better to inform users that path argument is from the viewpoint of bitcoind either absolute nor relative.
The problem is that users expects path argument is the viewpoint of RPC-caller, but actually the one of bitcoind. The former is not same as the latter even if absolute path if they executed on different docker.
So i added doc and output at this time.
Maybe an absolute path or if not, relative to the data-dir? If possible?

Also is there a "namespaced" name for this function? E.g., boost::filesystem::absolute? It'd be good to use the fully qualified name, otherwise it's difficult to hunt down such dependencies/lookup documentation.

I don't have a firm opinion to add to the above conversation though, except that I would add a way to get dumpwallet to serialize results across network (although dangerous if unencrypted/authenticated link) in case the user wants the wallet dump locally (RPC may even be called on a different machine let alone different directory as @aideca points out).

> Maybe an absolute path or if not, relative to the data-dir? If possible?

Good idea. It's our (effective) convention for command line arguments as well. I think it would be good to `chdir` the daemon to the data directory at start. This also avoids issues with the daemon holding on to resources (e.g. the starting directory could be deleted later) discussed in #8278.

>  RPC may even be called on a different machine

A way to dump the wallet over the network could be useful. The practical problem is that there is currently no way to do streaming writes to the network from RPC code, so the entire wallet would have to be dumped in memory, which would result in huge memory and parsing/generating overhead. I looked at streaming to the HTTP in a different context here: #7759.

Also yes there's a bit of a security concern though it's no different from dumpprivkey and friends...

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -561,7 +561,11 @@ UniValue dumpwallet(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "dumpwallet "filename"
"
             "
Dumps all wallet keys in a human-readable format.
"
             "
Arguments:
"
-            "1. "filename"    (string, required) The filename
"
+            "1. "filename"    (string, required) The filename (if not full path, relative to bitcoind path)
"
+            "
Result:
"
+            "{                           (json object)
"
+            "  "dumpfilepath" : {        (string) The filename
"
comments.body: I'd prefer to use the name "filename" (since this isn't just the path). You could change the help text to say "The filename with full absolute path"

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -561,7 +561,11 @@ UniValue dumpwallet(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "dumpwallet "filename"
"
             "
Dumps all wallet keys in a human-readable format.
"
             "
Arguments:
"
-            "1. "filename"    (string, required) The filename
"
+            "1. "filename"    (string, required) The filename (if not full path, relative to bitcoind path)
"
comments.body: The text is a bit clunky here. Perhaps "The filename with path (either absolute or relative to bitcoind)" is better?
